location: San Francisco,CA; Portland, OR; London, UK; Remote
title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
Your Mission, Should You Choose to Accept:

Expensify prides itself in solving a real world problem with a team of top notch engineers. Expense reports have long been a burden on the business world and working at Expensify means helping us automate every step of the process from the moment people incur their business expenses to the moment they get reimbursed with money in the bank (and everything in between!).

Joining our team means you will be working in our fast paced environment and you are fearless of our next big challenge. Even though we work hard at Expensify, we make sure our employees are happy. Our most discussed perk is our offshore where we spend a month abroad working from a remote location as a team. This year we went to Uruguay, do you want to join?

About You

Whether you’re building features like calendar integrations, importing credit card transactions, or pulling information from receipts, you’re self-driven and collaborative. You’re an autonomous individual who is passionate about making code beautiful and effective, and you’re open to working with other engineers and designers to make dreams into reality.

  • As a Full Stack Engineer, your responsibilities include:
  • Squashing bugs: big, small, and hairy!
  • Building features like accounting integrations, travel budgets, and more.
  • Guiding and enabling others in the technical organization: we'll share our editor tricks, dotfiles and productive workflow. Share yours!
  • Asking questions about things you don’t understand and challenging the status quo

For the best possible fit, we are looking for someone who:

  • Has experience writing real-world software to solve real-world solutions.
  • Communicates well, both in the code (WE <3 COMMENTS!) as well as with our team and industry partners -Is a natural problem solver
  • Wants to develop and grow their skills in programming and leadership within the organization

While we use a number of different technologies and languages, for this role we are looking for people who already have a strong understanding of JavaScript, PHP, C++, Java, algorithms, and design patterns. This position is the foundation for launching a career with Expensify, with the expectation you’ll carry these skills into new domains.

Compensation & Benefits

  • Full-time, salaried position
  • 401k with employer match
  • 100% Medical/Dental/Vision contributions
  • Commuter benefits
  • Free lunch
  • Flexible vacation policy
  • Work From Home when you need it

Next Steps

Applying is easy, but it takes time. See, while we know you're awesome, it's actually really hard and time consuming to find you in the midst of literally hundreds of other applications we get from everyone else. So this is where we're going to ask our first favor: can you make it really easy and obvious how great you are, so we don't accidentally overlook you? There are probably many ways to do that, but the easiest way is to help us out by answering the following questions:

  1. What's the URL of your website? If you don't have one, why not?
  2. What's your coding history? When did you start, and what have you done between then and now?
  3. What do you want to do with the rest of your life, and how is Expensify a step toward your long-term goals?
  4. How did you hear about us? A job posting? Chalk on a sidewalk? From a friend? Let us know where you saw this opening.

Resume not your thing? That’s great, we don’t really read them anyway! Forward your responses to the questions to jobs@expensify.com. We're excited to hear from you!

title: Front-End Developer
description:
Overview

Are you ready to work in a new environment? Let’s do this! Now is the time to make that move to an agency position that empowers you to own your work from start to finish, create great things and work on challenging digital projects. Here at Vitamin, we love WordPress. We love attention to detail. And we love bringing our designs to life with polished front-end code that is mobile-first, SEO-friendly, accessible, and light weight. Javascript skills? Check! PHP and MySQL skills? Check! Experience with JS animation libraries and JS frameworks? Now we’re talking. We enable our developers to leverage their complete talent sets by bringing a process that results in solid build work and strong creative. You will have direct access to clients and be involved in kick-off meetings and design presentations. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and a unique client roster that spans a variety of industries to keep things fresh and challenging. The ideal candidate will have 2-5 years experience in an agency or in-house setting.

Must-Haves

  • Thorough knowledge of HTML, CSS, and Responsive design
  • Experience with Javascript and jQuery
  • A working knowledge of PHP, MySQL
  • Experience with WordPress – the more the better
  • 2-5 years professional experience
  • 4-year degree
  • Understanding of typography and the ability to utilize type effectively
  • Passion to learn and succeed; ability to take well to constructive criticism
  • Motivation to work individually and as a team in a fast-paced, client-centric business environment
  • Attention to detail along with the ability to self manage and follow directions

Nice-to-Haves

  • Experience with JS frameworks (React, Vue)
  • Experience with JS animation libraries (GSAP, anime.js)
  • Experience with eCommerce platforms such as WooCommerce, BigCommerce, Shopify, Magento
  • Experience with HubSpot, Marketo, other Marketing Automation platforms
  • Agency background is a plus

The Position Requires

  • Ability to concurrently balance and execute upon on multiple projects
  • Ability to understand, manage and meet deadlines
  • Passion for detail

Benefits

We all work to make money. And when you join the Vitamin team, you will be compensated well in exchange for the time and talent you are devoting to your career and to our success, as an agency. We also offer a comprehensive benefits package, inclusive of medical, dental and vision; 401(k) with employer match; 3-week vacation to start with escalation; Summer Fridays, Takeout Tuesday; Mental Health Days, and much more beyond those “standard” employment benefits. Some of the perks our team appreciates the most, and gets super excited about include:

  • Location: the opportunity to work in an exciting location, in office space that is warm, inviting, and inspiring. Our office is positioned just one short block from the Creative Alliance, which is buzzing weekly with new art exhibitions, dance and music performances, movie showings, poetry readings, educational programs and other events that will keep any creative person’s heart content.

  • Work Environment: Most days, we’ve got the music pumping. And while we work hard, we also realize taking breathers throughout the day is not only necessary, but also gives us the chance to build personal relationships with those we work with side-by side. Plus, we know these little breathers ultimately make us more productive.

  • Parking: It’s plentiful, and it’s free.

  • Daily Style: We believe comfort is key and encourage you to dress in a way that is polished and professional for meetings, and work-appropriate the rest of the time.

  • Coffee is Key: We know it, and you know it. If you’re a coffee aficionado like many of us, you’ll quickly join the daily grind at our QuickMill Anita espresso machine.

  • Lunchtime Options: We’re a quick hop, skip, or jump away from some pretty cool and eclectic hot spots, from Canton Square and Patterson Park to local favorites like Atwater’s, DiPasquale’s, Matthew’s Pizza, and Snake Hill Tavern. We love food!

  • Bragging Rights: We crank out award-winning work. And at the end of the day, when your name is on it, you can say you were part of making it all happen.

About Vitamin

Wondering what Vitamin is all about? We are a Baltimore-based agency, delivering deeply branded integrated marketing-communications solutions for clients who need and want to bring their unique differences to life digitally and beyond. Growing and evolving each and every day for more than 15 years, we manage only the best, most collaborative and high-performing client-agency relationships. We develop and deliver strategies, campaigns and programs that aren’t just out of the box; they’re nowhere near the box. They lead to trackable, measurable results that make us, as well as the clients we serve, extremely proud. That said, when the time comes for us to recruit new talent to join our tight-knit team, we are looking for the best of the best. It’s what we want and absolutely need, and it’s what our clients demand.
how_to_apply: Submit your resume, online portfolio (PDF and/or URL) and salary requirements to careers@vitaminisgood.com with the subject line: Front-End Developer.

title: Full-Stack Rails Software Engineer
description:
=== US ===

BLADE is changing the way people travel, opening up new routes and making options like helicopters and seaplanes affordable though technology. We provide helicopter and fixed wing flights between Manhattan, the Hamptons, LA, and a growing number of other destinations. Our app offers the ability to simply grab a single seat or launch your own crowdsourced flight.

We've had an incredibly successful first few years and are building out the team to take us to the next level.

=== YOU ===

We're looking for Senior and Junior full stack engineers experienced in Ruby on Rails and Javascript to help us build the experience that changes the aviation game.

=== REQUIREMENTS ===

  • 1+ years experience in shipping software features for a company - We're looking for both Junior and Senior Rails engineers.
how_to_apply: Email your resume and cover letter to bernadette@flyblade.com. Include a brief cover letter about your experience, why you're interested in BLADE, and a link to your Github.

title: Senior MS SQL Server Developer
description:
Day rate or 1-year fixed term PAYE contract available

SELECT TOP(1) C.SQLServerDeveloper FROM Candidates C WHERE C.Skills = 'excellent' AND C.Attitude = 'amazing'

ORDER BY C.DayRate ASC

What you’ll love about working in the IT team at A-Gas Europe

You’ll work on a project that has a specific aim. That’s to deliver changes to our bespoke systems in order to scale them out across Europe ready for a greenfield SAP ERP implementation which brings all operational aspects of HR, Finance, Operations and Sales and Service together in one common platform.

Rather than a general “can you develop in X, Y and hopefully, Z set of requirements”. You’ll use SQL technologies to enable us to get the most of our current bespoke and off the shelf software solutions used to improve business processes.

You’ll be expected to review, develop and adapt our systems to ensure they’re able to operate continuously without significant disruption for the looming SAP solution.

You’ll be working within a small friendly team, so if you’re someone who enjoys that close-knit environment you will fit in nicely.

If you have a ‘can-do‘ attitude, enjoy tasks varying from one day to the next and are able to make commercially sensible judgements then you may be exactly what we’re looking for.

You’ll be based at our new site in Portbury which is 3 times as large as our existing site. It will have a large canteen, purpose-built m/f locker rooms, nice views of the bustling Portbury docks and the potential for onsite gym/ picnic area.

You’ll improve the way our people spend their working days. On a European-scale.

What you’ll get in return

We offer a competitive starting salary or day rate. If you opt for the fixed term contract, you’ll be entitled to a very good profit-related bonus and pension scheme.

You’ll open the door to European opportunities in the UK, Netherlands and Germany.

And who are we…?

We’re the European region of A-Gas, a global gases business with significant private equity backing. We have a market leading position and are growing globally. Our aim is to grow our position as a leading supplier of refrigerants.

Today we’re represented across the globe, with ambition to treble our current size in Europe over the next three years.

Which means huge opportunity for the people in our business. People like you.

What are you waiting for?

Apply today via the applicationform and let’s start talking about where you want to take your career.

FAO Agencies:

We do not appreciate applications and/or CVs from recruitment agencies unless expressly agreed otherwise by the Talent Acquisition team.

For the avoidance of doubt any applications and/or CVs provided outside of the process shall be considered speculative and shall not constitute a valid Introduction. Any subsequent engagement arising out of such applications and/or CVs shall not therefore attract any Introduction Fee save where A-Gas expressly agrees otherwise.

Requirements

Who you are?

You’re already in an MS SQL Server Developer role. Your most recent experience is broad and covers the breadth of things like relational database design and development with Microsoft SQL and T-SQL, and SSRS (versions between 2008 -2017) and Source Control. If you’ve understanding of DBA including MS Query Analyser and TSQLT or SQL testing, then you’ll have a head start.

You’ve worked on an integration project before and have experience implementing and maintaining multi-site / country systems.

You’re experienced in contracting or prioritising the job in hand and want to get on with it.

You’re curious, ask questions and like to solve problems. Finding out how things work is interesting to you.

Sound like you?

Then we might just be a fit

Click here to apply!

title: Front-end Developer
description:
Compano zoekt collega (m/v) voor kantoor Sneek

Front-end Developer 32-40 uur per week

Over de functie Steeds meer klanten zien het belang van goede artikel- en productdata. Compano heeft uitstekende software om data te verrijken (PIM) of te gebruiken (MDM en calculatie). Om data te delen is Artikelbeheer.nl een bekende datapool in de markt.

Voor het ontwerpen en ontwikkelen van een nieuw user-interface zoeken wij een front-end developer met kennis van de gangbare web-development technieken.

Voor de realisatie van dit user-interface/front-end is een goede samenwerking met de back-end ontwikkelaars van belang voor de integratie met de huidige applicatie.

Het ontwerp zal afgestemd moeten worden met klanten/consultants en productontwikkeling.

Je gaat zelfstandig dit interface ontwerpen en ontwikkelen binnen het huidige ontwikkelteam met standplaats Sneek.

Wat vragen wij van jou?

  • Je beschikt over een flexibele, service- en klantgerichte instelling
  • Je kunt goed in teamverband werken
  • Opleiding op HBO niveau.
  • Relevante kwalificaties of werkervaring
  • Minimaal 3 jaar professionele ervaring in development.
  • Uitstekende beheersing van HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Json. Kennis van Typescript is een pré
  • Bekend met minimaal één groot front-end framework bij voorkeur Angular.
  • Uitstekend Nederlands en Engels.
  • Een verlangen om jezelf constant te verbeteren

Wat bieden wij jou?

  • Uitdagende en afwisselende functie in een professionele en stimulerende omgeving
  • Meegroeien met het bedrijf
  • Veel ruimte om zelf te bepalen hoe je invulling geeft aan je werk en functie
  • Persoonlijke, informele klant/resultaatgerichte werksfeer
  • Een kennis gedreven werkomgeving
  • We werken met uitdagende en leuke (internationale) klanten
  • Je ontvangt een goed salaris afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring.
  • Relevante opleiding voor (toekomstige) functie altijd bespreekbaar.

Over Compano, producten en diensten Compano is dé specialist op het gebied van online software voor de bouw- en installatiebranche. Onze klanten zijn actief als producent, handelaar of installateur. Met ons Product Informatie Management (PIM) systeem verbeteren producenten hun productdata waardoor hun eindklanten beter kunnen kiezen. Het Master Data Management (MDM) systeem zorgt voor eenvoudig assortimentsbeheer, inclusief inkoop- en verkoopcondities voor groothandelaren en inkoopverenigingen. Op datapool www.artikelbeheer.nl wisselen bedrijven op eenvoudige wijze product- en artikeldata uit, op basis van de ETIM-standaard. Data van artikelbeheer.nl kan ook direct in onze online calculatiesoftware worden gebruikt of in (bedrijfs)software van derden.

Compano, het bedrijf Is opgericht in 1998 en heeft passie voor data. Compano is begonnen in Sneek en telt nu in totaal 20 medewerkers, verspreid over de vestigingen Arnhem en Sneek. Vestiging Arnhem zorgt voor de marketing, verkoop, consultancy en implementatie van projecten. Sneek zorgt voor de productontwikkeling, administratie, de ICT-infrastructuur en biedt support voor al onze klanten.

Compano heeft al 20 jaar een open en sociale bedrijfssfeer. We zijn authentiek en betrokken, in zowel de omgang met opdrachtgevers als met collega's en willen excelleren in ons werk. Hoewel datamanagement als vakgebied complex kan zijn, willen we vooral pragmatische en resultaatgerichte oplossingen bieden aan onze klanten. Compano is ondernemend en onze medewerkers zijn professioneel en gaan goed om met hun eigen verantwoordelijkheid. We kiezen voor langlopende samenwerkingen boven gewin op korte termijn, zowel met onze klanten en partners als met ons personeel.

Interesse en solliciteren? Voor meer informatie over de functie kan je bellen naar Henk Koops (Technisch Directeur) op nummer 06 – 218 66 161

Als je wilt solliciteren, mail dan je CV en een korte toelichting via onze sollicitatiepagina

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.
how_to_apply: Als je wilt solliciteren, mail dan je CV en een korte toelichting via onze sollicitatiepagina

title: Software Engineer voor de Cloud
description:
Software Engineer voor de Cloud Den Haag

Wat ga je bij ons doen? Als ervaren softwareontwikkelaar ben je toe aan een ontwikkelstap. Jij gaat bij ons cloud-technologie leren, realiseren en toepassen zodat onderzoekers hier eenvoudig gebruik van kunnen maken en zich kunnen richten op hun eigen onderzoek. In je rol van Software Engineer voor het CLARIAH project houd je je bezig met het ontwerpen en realiseren van applicaties voor tekstonderzoek in een cloud-omgeving. Je leert bij ons alle fijne kneepjes van Kubernetes, want hiermee ga je de cloud-omgeving opzetten en de componenten bouwen.

In deze veelzijdige baan voer je niet alleen de realisatie uit, maar ondersteun je ook de besluitvorming over de te maken technische keuzes. Je leert ook functionele eisen te vertalen en de gewenste architectuur te realiseren in werkende producten en componenten voor de cloud. Je bent gewend om gestructureerd en zelfstandig in teamverband te werken en hebt ervaring met Agile en Scrum. Je krijgt ruimte om te pionieren en nieuwe ontwikkelingen te verkennen en dit te vertalen naar nieuwe, bruikbare oplossingen. 

Wat bied jij?

  • Minimaal hbo-werk -en -denkniveau.
  • Leergierig en gedreven om het vak van Cloud Engineer te leren.
  • Aantoonbare relevante werkervaring met softwareontwikkeling.
  • Een goed analytisch vermogen, pragmatisch, oplossings- en resultaatgericht, proactief, creatief.
  • Kennis van Python, Java en/of Shell-scripting en bent bekend met broncode-versiebeheer systemen zoals GIT en SVN.
  • Zakelijk/technisch communicatief vaardig, zowel in het Nederlands als in het Engels.
  • Als je kennis hebt van Linux systeem-administratie en van CI/CD, Ansible en/of DevOps is dat een pre.

Wat bieden wij?

  • Een tijdelijk dienstverband voor 40 uur per week, in eerste instantie voor de periode van 1 jaar, met uitzicht op een verlenging.
  • Een goed salaris tussen € 2.736,- en € 4.339,- bruto per maand (schaal 10) op basis van 40 uur, een dertiende maand (8,33%) en volledige vergoeding van je dagelijkse reiskosten.
  • Je bouwt pensioen op via het pensioenfonds ABP.
  • Een aantrekkelijk arbeidsvoorwaardenpakket dat je deels zelf kunt samenstellen, waaronder het kopen en verkopen van vakantiedagen.
  • Een goede balans tussen werk en privé vinden wij belangrijk. Daarom kun je afspraken maken over flexibele werktijden, heb je veel vakantiedagen (42 dagen per jaar bij een volledige baan) en wordt ouderschapsverlof gedeeltelijk doorbetaald. In veel functies behoort ook thuiswerken tot de mogelijkheden.
  • Alle ruimte om te leren en je verder te ontwikkelen.
  • Een werkplek in hartje Den Haag op drie minuten lopen vanaf het Centraal Station.

Koninklijke Bibliotheek De Koninklijke Bibliotheek is een nationaal en internationaal bekend instituut: we zijn één van de grote Nederlandse erfgoed- en wetenschapsinstellingen en hebben een belangrijke coördinerende rol in het netwerk van openbare bibliotheken. Tot de taken behoren onder meer het bewaren, verzamelen en beschikbaar stellen van alle publicaties die in of over Nederland worden uitgegeven en het bouwen aan de nationale digitale bibliotheek. 

Waar kom je bij ons werken? Je werkt in een team IT-ontwikkeling met 20 gedreven software engineers, waar gewerkt wordt aan projecten en componenten die de landelijke diensten voor Openbare Bibliotheken realiseren, maar ook aan KB-diensten zoals Delpher en een Digitaal Magazijn voor het Nederlands geschreven woord. Binnen dit team ben jij de pionier voor cloudtechnologie op basis van Kubernetes. Als lid van het CLARIAH projectteam werk je samen met onderzoekers, architecten en ontwikkelaars aan de realisatie van een onderzoeksinfrastructuur voor grootschalige tekstbestanden.

Hebben we je interesse gewekt? Stuur je cv en een motivatie waarom jij de ideale kandidaat bent voor de functie van Software Engineer voor de Cloud via het online sollicitatieformulier. Het vacaturenummer is vacaturenummer 19-09-012-H.

Om je alvast beter te leren te kennen willen we je vragen om in je motivatiebrief ons iets te vertellen over je huidige kennis van cloudtechnologie en vooral waarom je dat bij ons wil leren.

De selectieprocedure bestaat uit twee gespreksrondes. Na ontvangst van je sollicitatie laten wij je snel weten of je voor een eerste gesprek wordt uitgenodigd.

Wil je eerst meer weten? Bel dan met Harrie Hazewinkel (Teamleider IT-ontwikkeling), tel. 070 314 03 78. Bel voor algemene vragen naar 06 2149 3839. Of kijk op www.academictransfer.com/en/employer/KB/ voor meer informatie.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

title: QA Engineer
description:
Be a part of an exciting journey

At Cobiro we're using machine learning and AI to build the next generation of online advertising experiences. We're on a mission to make online marketing easy-to-use, accessible and high-performing for everyone, and we're starting with Google Ads.

Working at Cobiro, you’ll join a flat and agile organisation where bright ideas are appreciated and implemented regardless of seniority or area of specialization. We’re ambitious and work hard, but also know how to let loose and celebrate our accomplishments. At Cobiro you will meet different nationalities and personalities. We have common denominators: We are self-starters and team-players, love to solve problems, and we create high quality solutions.

We offer:

  • Flexible working hours
  • An agile work environment
  • Focus on quality solutions
  • Options to attend relevant courses and conferences
  • A team of passionate, skilled and experienced colleagues
  • All the gear and food you need: breakfast on Fridays, lunch every day, sodas, fruit, vegetables and sweets
  • On-site massage
  • Frequent social company activities, Friday bar included
  • Good working equipment
  • A great working location at Esplanaden, Central Copenhagen

The opportunity

We are looking for a QA Engineer to assess software quality through manual and automated testing. You have documented professional experience as a QA Engineer or a similar role - preferably with large-scale enterprise and/or cloud solutions.

Within the first couple of months you will be getting a thorough introduction and overview of our product and systems, and will continue to work in an increasingly independent role with growing responsibilities. You will become responsible for documenting and troubleshooting errors, and will join a growing QA team within our engineering department. Once a pull request has been approved it is up to the QA to merge it onto a test server and manage the rest of the release flow (testing - building - releasing) in collaboration with the developers.

You should have a keen eye for detail and excellent communication skills, as well as being competent in executing test cases and being passionate about quality. If you are also an open-minded team-player who is kind, intelligent, driven to build great solutions, with a good sense of humor we’d like to meet you.

Ultimately, you will ensure that our products, applications and systems work correctly.

For this position, you will need:

  • Knowledge of SQL
  • Knowledge of JavaScript
  • Experience with building an automated test framework (Selenium tests), as well as the ability to write automated tests
  • An understanding of JSON

Nice to have:

  • Experience with Github
  • Experience with Postman test
how_to_apply:
We are looking forward to receiving your application through our application system - simply click on "Apply for this job" and attach your CV and/or Linkedin account.

https://cobiro.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=58

You will always get a reply when applying through our system.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Be a part of an exciting journey

At Cobiro we're using machine learning and AI to build the next generation of online advertising experiences. We're on a mission to make online marketing easy-to-use, accessible and high-performing for everyone, and we're starting with Google Ads.

Working at Cobiro, you’ll join a flat and agile organisation where bright ideas are appreciated and implemented regardless of seniority or area of specialization. We’re ambitious and work hard, but also know how to let loose and celebrate our accomplishments. At Cobiro you will meet different nationalities and personalities. We have common denominators: We are self-starters and team-players, love to solve problems, and we create high quality solutions.

We offer:

  • Flexible working hours
  • An agile work environment
  • Focus on quality solutions
  • Options to attend relevant courses and conferences
  • A team of passionate, skilled and experienced colleagues
  • All the gear and food you need: breakfast on Fridays, lunch every day, massages, sodas, fruit, vegetables and sweets
  • Frequent social company activities, Friday bar included
  • Good working equipment
  • A great working location at Esplanaden, Central Copenhagen

The opportunity

Cobiro is automating online advertising and our AI team is looking for an ambitious Data Engineer looking to get real-life-experience building big data infrastructure. You will be the second Data Engineer in the team working with experienced industry professionals building scalable big data systems for analytics and AI applications. We are currently working on Google Ads and will expand to other platforms this year.

In your role as a Data Engineer, you will work closely with talented professionals in designing and implementing high performance and flexible data tools using cloud computing services. We expect you to be a team player who is comfortable using agile methodologies to capture the optimal designs and architectures for our solutions. You are already in the habit of learning, prototyping, and deploying emerging data technologies on a daily basis. The position offers the opportunity to get hands-on domain experience right from the start.

Not required, but nice to have would be experience with NoSQL databases (e.g. DynamoDB, Cassandra), experience developing and deploying applications on Linux-based technologies (e.g. containers), as well as knowledge and experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Quicksight, Tableau, Grafana).

Working at Cobiro you will work alongside colleagues with backgrounds in Software / Computer Engineering, Data Science, Informatics, Machine Learning, Robotics, Linear Programming, Natural Language Processing, and Gaming.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Implement, extend, and maintain our current data infrastructure
  • Support AI team in realizing new data sources
  • Design, along with AI engineers and business stakeholders, the appropriate data models and ETL pipelines to satisfy our novel Machine Learning models and Business Analytics insights.

Requirements:

  • MSc degree in Computer Science / Engineering, Software Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field
  • Experience with data lakes / warehouse, ETL pipelines and scalable systems
  • Strong skills and working experience in Python programming
  • Experience working in cloud computing services, preferably AWS
  • Experience with SQL and relational databases (e.g. MySQL, Postgres)

We are looking forward to receiving your application through our application system - simply click on "Apply for this job" and attach your CV and/or Linkedin account.

You will always get a reply when applying through our system.

title: UX Designer
description:
Job Summary

Clinical Graphics is a software company and part of Zimmer Biomet, a globally leading player in products for orthopedic surgery. Clinical Graphics specializes in pre-operative planning and image segmentation software. For example, the Move Forward service provides custom-tailored interactive 3D bone models and patient specific range of motion simulations to orthopedic surgeons by analyzing medical scans of hip joints. Surgeons can see in 3D motion how well a joint moves, and what the effects of surgery may potentially be. Have a look:

https://www.zimmerbiomet.com/medical-professionals/hip-preservation/3d-motion-hip-analysis.html

Reporting to the Project Manager, the candidate will be based in the Clinical Graphics team (Delft). As a UX Designer at Clinical Graphics you will be responsible for designing user-friendly software.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities

  • Gather inputs from users and stakeholders (based on business objectives and technical capabilities)
  • Creation of UX outputs (user personas, user journeys, user process flows, wireframes/sketches/prototypes, etc)
  • Conduct workshops & brainstorming sessions with team members or with users to define design direction and concepts
  • Validate prototypes through formative and summative usability tests with surgeons
  • Creation & maintenance of Design History Files (DHF) through the product life cycle
  • Creation and maintenance of Design and Development Plans
  • Determining and documenting the User Needs and Design Inputs
  • Performing Design Verification and Design Validation activities and documenting evidence from those activities
  • Represent the voice of the user toward the software development team

Expected Areas of Competence

  • Experienced and up to date with UX design methods and tools
  • Full working knowledge of and moderate level of experience with new product development and maintenance of existing products

Up to 10% international travel will be required, including weekend travel

title: Full Stack Web Engineer / .NET
description:
Full Stack Web Engineer / .NET

About Aramark:

Aramark (NYSE: ARMK) proudly serves Fortune 500 companies, world champion sports teams, state-of-the-art healthcare providers, the world’s leading educational institutions, iconic destinations and cultural attractions, and numerous municipalities in 19 countries around the world. Our 270,000 team members deliver experiences that enrich and nourish millions of lives every day through innovative services in food, facilities management and uniforms. We operate our business with social responsibility, focusing on initiatives that support our diverse workforce, advance consumer health and wellness, protect our environment, and strengthen our communities. Aramark is recognized as one of the World’s Most Admired Companies by FORTUNE, as well as an employer of choice by the Human Rights Campaign and DiversityInc. Learn more at www.aramark.com or connect with us on Facebook and Twitter.

About Avendra:

Avendra is North America’s leading hospitality procurement services provider. Avendra was founded in 2001 by hospitality management companies looking to leverage buying power and create efficiencies in supply chain management. Acquired by Aramark in 2017, Avendra now manages supplier contracts and sourcing responsibilities for Aramark businesses in North America, other group purchasing organizations owned by Aramark, as well as our traditional hospitality clients. We combine years of hospitality expertise, purchasing power, services and software to help customers impact the bottom line, improve operational performance, and better serve guests and customers. Avendra is headquartered in Rockville, Maryland and employs about 400 associates.

Avendra develops and operates state of the art eProcurement and supply chain management solutions which enable our company to deliver benefits beyond great savings—impacting the bottom line, improving operational performance and allowing our customers to better serve their guests.

The scope of your job here will be much broader than you’ll find at other companies – you won’t be pigeon holed into doing just one category of work or learning one technology. We have a small, nimble eCommerce team that covers the entire spectrum of business analysis, development and operations for our proprietary eProcurement systems.

We connect thousands of suppliers with thousands of customers, and leverage machine learning, sophisticated data modeling and warehousing to analyze, audit and ensure quality and savings are delivered at every level.

About iBuyEfficient:

iBuyEfficient, our proprietary cloud-based purchase order technology provides our customers withan industry leading hub that is always “one click” away from all of their suppliers. This one-stop purchasing solution delivers robust controls to drive down purchasing costs and maximizes performance and profitability for each of our clients.

About the Role:

  • Develop and maintain the current iBuyEfficient Platform in C# ASP.Net and JavaScript/Typescript
  • Design, implement and test API and custom integrations with our customers and supplier partners
  • Participate in work related to advanced eProcurement & eCommerce technologies including Procure-to-Pay and AP/AR integrations
  • Take ownership of all aspects of our software product – architecture, quality, user experience
  • Work closely and collaboratively with the iBuyEfficient product development team in implementing customer requirements
  • Work with V.P. of Development to architect, design and implement the future state of the platform using modern web frameworks including ReactJS, Typescript, Server-side Rendering, CSS in JS, etc.

Environment:

  • 60% on-site at Avendra's facility in Aliso Viejo, CA
  • 40% work from home potential

Requirements:

  • 5+ years, Professional experience in C#/ASP.Net web development including JavaScript
  • A good understanding of OO, design patterns and an interest in other development paradigms (i.e. Functional Programming, Declarative vs. Imperative, etc.)
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Knowledge of agile software development processes and tools like Git, Jenkins, TeamCity and Jira or TestTrack
  • Understanding of database concepts / ORM
  • Solid understanding of testing, continuous integration and deployment practices
  • Self-motivated. Creative. Continuous Learner.

Bonus Points:

  • Familiar with Typescript or other typed JavaScript tools
  • Familiar with ReactJS or other component-based UI frameworks
  • Familiar with responsive design techniques
  • Passionate about new technologies, languages, frameworks etc.

Technologies We Use:

  • C#, ASP.Net, JavaScript, Typescript
  • AWS
  • Oracle, RavenDB
  • Devart, EntityFramework, LLBLGEN
  • KendoUI, Angular, SASS

title: Software Developer
description:
We are looking for Software Developer to join our team in Burnaby, BC.

The Opportunity:

The Software Developer’s role is to provide research, design, development and testing of software systems. This includes coding, developing, and documenting technical specifications throughout the project life cycle. Once the system has been deployed the Software Developer will maintain the system as appropriate to assignment. The Software Developer will have knowledge of a variety of computer programming languages and applications. The Software Developer will provide support to other projects where required. The Software Developer will be assigned to projects by the Software Development Manager and work on the project under the direction of a Project Manager as a member of an agile team. Within the Software organization the Software Developer will be member of a small home room team to aid in their development.

In this role you’ll: •Collaborate with architects, programmers and designers in conceptualizing and development of new software programs and applications. •Liaise with network administrators and business analysts to assist in resolving problems with software products or company software systems. •Analyze and assess existing business systems and procedures. •Assist in the definition, development, and documentation of software business requirements, objectives, deliverables, and specifications on a project-by-project basis in collaboration with internal users and departments. •Assist in defining software development project plans, including scoping, scheduling, and implementation. •Research, identify, analyze, and fulfill requirements of all internal and external program users. •Consistently write, translate, and code software programs and applications according to specifications. •Write code in Javascript and other languages to enhance functionality and/or performance of company applications as necessary. •Design, run and monitor software performance tests on new and existing programs for the purposes of correcting errors, isolating areas for improvement, and general debugging. •Administer critical analysis of test results and deliver solutions to problem areas. •Provide estimates and status Project Manager. •Develop and maintain user manuals and guidelines. •Train end users to operate new or modified programs. •Install software products for end users as required. •Creation and execution of Unit Test Cases. •Collaboration with the QA team. •Provide effort / time estimates on development tasks. •After hours, on-call support is required on a rotational basis. •Sundry duties as assigned.

Here’s what you bring: •College diploma or university degree in the field of computer science, information systems, or software engineering or equivalent experience. •At least 5 years of software development experience. •Experience working in an Agile software development environment. •Depending on the position requirements technically fluent in Python, and Javascript. •Familiar with database programming languages, including. PostgreSQL, SQL or PL/SQL. •Familiar with Couchbase and Kafka. •Experience with n-tier design patterns. •Familiarity with Test Driven design. •Knowledge of current Internet technologies; web application design and integration experience. •Hands-on software troubleshooting experience. •Experience with XML, JSON and web services architectures. •Experience with Git or other similar source control tools. •Ability to work in a project focused multi-disciplined team. •Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities. •Must be able to learn, understand, and apply new technologies. •Strong written and oral communication skills. •Strong interpersonal skills. •Customer service skills an asset. •Highly logical; Highly self motivated and directed. •Keen attention to detail. This job will require you to: •Occasional ability to work from home. •Occasional on-call availability. •Occasional evening and weekend work to meet deadlines. •Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a computer keyboard, mouse, and to handle other computer components. •Lifting and transporting of moderately heavy objects, such as computers and peripherals. •Some travel may be required for the purpose of off-site software and system applications management, and meetings.

What We Offer:

Our success is built on the drive and dedication of our people. As we grow around the globe, there will be many opportunities to advance your career – we’ve proven this throughout our 60+ years in business. And, we'll take care of you along the way. Here’s how: •Base salary + paid overtime •Comprehensive medical and dental benefits. •RRSP and an Employee Share Plan, both with company match. •Ongoing training, professional development and tuition reimbursement.

  • A multi-award winning LEED gold certified facility, in an exceptional park-like setting, featuring: ◦A subsidized, multi-award winning childcare centre. ◦A subsidized cafeteria, dry cleaning services, and free parking. ◦A workout facility, featuring advanced gym equipment, bike room, shower and changing facilities, and nutrition and fitness programs. ◦Proximity to miles of Fraser River walking paths, plus shops, restaurants and services.

To get an idea of what our auctions are like, you can check out some auction videos on YouTube right here: http://bit.ly/KKL9Fz.

To learn more about the company? Visit our Career site, LinkedIn Or, connect with our recruiters by visiting our Facebook.

Established in 1958, Ritchie Bros. (NYSE and TSX: RBA) is a global asset management and disposition company, offering customers end-to-end solutions for buying and selling used heavy equipment, trucks and other assets. Operating in a multitude of sectors, including construction, transportation, agriculture, energy, oil and gas, mining, and forestry, the company’s selling channels include: Ritchie Bros. Auctioneers, the world’s largest industrial auctioneer offers live auction events with online bidding; IronPlanet,, an online marketplace with featured weekly auctions and providing its exclusive IronClad Assurance® equipment condition certification;Marketplacee, an online marketplace offering multiple price and timing options; Mascus, a leading European online equipment listing service; and Ritchie Bros. Private Treaty, offering privately negotiated sales. The company also offers sector-specific solutions including GovPlanet, TruckPlanet, Kruse Energy Auctioneers, and Cat® auctions, plus equipment financing and leasing through Ritchie Bros. Financial Services. For more information about the unprecedented choice provided by Ritchie Bros, visit RitchieBros.com.

Ritchie Bros. is an equal opportunity employer and ensures nondiscrimination in all activities in accordance with all applicable laws. This position is open to all qualified applicants who are legally entitled to work in the country in which this job is located. Candidate selection is made by Talent Acquisition. Only electronic applications can be accepted. No agency calls please.

title: React.js Developer at DHOS
description:
Why DHOS?

The DHOS platform is making history by building a decentralized ecosystem designed to minimize the role of intermediaries in services and return lost value to brands and consumers. Systems today are designed in favor of the middlemen who extract fees from services that should be commoditized. By creating an open network that can directly connect consumers and brands.

We are backed by a VC and several investors. We are on target to launch the MVP.

Skills

React, Redux, Bootstrap, Web Development

Compensation

Salary and equity for the right candidate. We'll discuss based on experience.

title: Full Stack Web Developer
description:
FLIR Integrated Imaging Solutions (IIS), a division of FLIR systems, is one of the world’s leading manufacturers of machine vision digital cameras. Our cameras are vital components in the fast growing, transformative industries of robotics, autonomous vehicles, industrial automation, virtual reality, medical/life sciences and retail analytics.

We are looking for a Full Stack Web Developer with strong UI design and RestAPI services experience. The primary role of this position is to build and maintain a suite of IoT devices, a cloud based web application and create user friendly workflows apps. The developer chosen will work alongside embedded engineers and application engineers to improve product capabilities and stability. Willingness to cross into other environments is desired.

Detailed Description:

  • Follow the Agile Development Processing including:Daily stand up meetings, Ticket creation, Weekly backlog grooming and ticket pointing
  • Design new product screens based on requirements
  • Build and maintain the product UI for a suite of cameras running different hardware
  • Enhance and maintain the RestAPI
  • Create and maintain automated tests
  • Build machine maintenance
  • Collaborate well in a team environment

  Requirements:

  • Experience with JavaScript, HTML & CSS, Nodejs, Python, JSON & XML, RestAPI Standards,
  • Experience with Agile + Jira

FLIR and all our employees are committed to conducting business with the highest ethical standards. title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
EverQuote is seeking a strong software engineer who is able to provide exceptional technical skills and become a solid contributor to our team as they rebuild the current code base and transition to a microservices architecture. This team is responsible for the realization of our new remarketing strategy, which drives nearly 50% of the company’s revenue. You will updating our current remarketing infrastructure using more modern methods, python microservices and containerization technology (Docker,Kubernetes) in the Google cloud.

The role offers you the opportunity to work on systems involving large and complex data sets, high-volume traffic, and near-real-time feedback. Our Software Engineers work closely with analytics stakeholders inside the company to understand business problems, to design & propose efficient solutions for those problems, and to effectively translate those ideas into correct, clean, and maintainable code.

Technologies used: Python on Linux platforms, MySQL, Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform, DataBricks.

Responsibilities:

  • Build and extend remarketing and analytics systems, to improve consumer engagement and -performance
  • Collaborate closely with acquisition teams and data scientists to develop and automate remarketing strategies
  • Design and implement new features for various Python-based services & platforms
  • Improve robustness of business operations and technical platforms via reporting, monitoring, and alerting
  • Analyze, debug, and resolve operational issues on our production systems
  • Drive strategic thinking about how to evolve online marketing opportunities available to us

You Have:

  • 2+ years experience as a software engineer in a fast paced, data driven environment
  • Solid computer science fundamentals, including algorithms, data structures, optimization, threading
  • Experience working with and open source language (ideally Python) & SQL on Linux, and with big data platforms
  • Able to translate ideas into correct, efficient, and reliable code solutions
  • Strong skills at understanding, analyzing, and debugging complex problems and/or systems
  • Great teamwork skills; willingness to both learn and mentor
  • Entrepreneurial mindset; sense of urgency and accountability
  • Deep Interest in online business and learning how to drive engineering solutions to solve business problems

Why EverQuote?

  • We are one of the fastest growing companies in Boston history
  • We recently completed our IPO and are looking for the next generation of leaders to push us forward as a public company
  • Even as we’ve become a public company, we’re committed to maintaining our “startup feel,” (but with none of that startup anxiety)
  • We employ completely data-driven decision-making
  • We encourage creative thinking, independent responsibilities for business results & team collaboration
  • Lunch catering to the office, company outings to local restaurants, day trips, and more
  • We offer competitive salaries, excellent benefits, stock, and a relaxed & flexible work environment
  • We have lives outside of work. We are musicians, athletes, filmmakers, gamers, authors, and more

EverQuote (Nasdaq: EVER) makes insurance shopping easy, efficient and personal, saving consumers and insurance providers time and money. We operate the largest online marketplace for insurance shopping in the United States. Our goal is to reshape insurance shopping for consumers and improve the way insurance providers attract and connect with customers as insurance shopping continues to shift online.

title: Solutions Engineer
description:
As a Solutions Engineer at CircleCI, you will be the customer’s trusted technical advisor throughout the sales process. You’ll provide hands-on support for cloud-based and single tenant deployment and product guidance with CircleCI’s largest customers.

*This is a remote role based in London.

About Sales Solutions at CircleCI

Our Solutions Engineers have a strong understanding of the developer community and are able to confidently communicate with and provide first class support to developers, DevOps leads, and architects.

About CircleCI

CircleCI is the best platform for software teams looking to rapidly build quality projects, at scale. Our intelligent continuous integration and delivery tools are simple yet powerful. Our aim is to provide the wisdom of a connected development ecosystem to every team member making technology decisions.

We run 12M+ builds a month on our platform for companies like Spotify, Kickstarter, Sony, and Coinbase. Over 25,000 organizations and 300,000 developers actively build, test, and deploy on CircleCI. We’ve raised $59.5M in venture capital from Industry Ventures, Top Tier Capital, Scale Venture Partners, DFJ, Harrison Metal Capital, and Baseline Ventures.

What you’ll do:

  • Serve as the technical lead and owner of technical deal strategy
  • Collaborate with Account Executive to identify and uncover customer business goals, needs, and pains, and work to show how CircleCI can address them
  • Lead the technical implementation and day-to-day management of CircleCI Demonstrations and * Trials, integrated into our customer’s technology stack - ensuring early customer success and a long-term business relationship
  • Prove the technical feasibility of the CircleCI platform to highly technical and developer audiences
  • Stay on top of industry news, technology products, platforms, new CircleCI features, and partners to ensure you and your team provide and maintain a deep industry and ecosystem expertise
  • Identify areas of potential improvement in our sales efforts, and then work to improve them. This could be high level strategy, daily tactical efforts, or down in the weeks of creating documentation or how to videos
  • Custom development and launch of new sales products and customer integrations to our internal teams and customer community
  • Partner closely with our customer success teams to ensure continuity of an amazing customer experience - for life
  • Collaborate closely with Product and Engineering teams to help influence product roadmap based on market/customer requirements
  • Provide technical responses to RFPs and RFIs

What we’re looking for:

  • World class presentation skills. You feel comfortable leading presentations and demos of our platform to groups, both technical and non-technical, in-person and virtually
  • Work with customers directly to debug common errors without involving an engineer
  • You can tie business problems to technical solutions and understand technology value propositions
  • Demonstrated and proven capacity to quickly absorb new concepts and technologies
  • You have spent a decent amount of time using and scripting *nix
  • You know how to work with Git in general and ideally GitHub in particular
  • You’ve thrown together an app or two in a high-level programming language
  • You believe that the best way for all to succeed is to honestly discuss product and company abilities and limitations with customers. We do not oversell at CircleCI
  • Strong ops/infrastructure knowledge, especially networking and security

Bonus Points:

  • Experience with build, test, and deployment automation
  • Familiarity with Clojure and/or React/Javascript
  • Knowledge of Docker or Linux containers in general
  • Experience with popular web app frameworks (e.g. Rails, Django) and/or mobile app development (iOS, Android)
  • Experience using and automating a major IaaS like AWS, GCP, or Azure
  • Familiarity deploying and debugging distributed systems

If you’re interested in joining the team at CircleCI, please send a resume and tell us what inspires you and why you think you’re a good fit for the team. If you contribute to an open source project, or have a presence on the web (GitHub, Twitter, YouTube, LinkedIn, etc.) we’d love to hear about it.

CircleCI is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Kalepa is looking for Software Engineers to lead the development of our world-class software for commercial insurers.

Software engineers at Kalepa will be solving interesting and challenging problems at the intersection of data pipelines, cutting-edge machine learning models, and robust infrastructure. You will be working in a small team building technology from the ground up with the latest stack.

Kalepa is a New York based, VC backed, startup building software to transform and disrupt commercial insurance.

Nearly one trillion ($1T) dollars are spent globally each year on commercial insurance across small, medium, and large enterprises. However, the process for estimating the risk associated with a given business across various perils (e.g. fire, injury, malpractice) is still reliant on inefficient and inaccurate manual forms or outdated and sparse databases. This information asymmetry leads to a broken set of economic incentives and a poor experience for both businesses and insurers alike. By combining cutting edge data science, enterprise software, and insurance expertise, Kalepa will turn real-world data into a complete understanding of risk – leading to more profitable, efficient, and applicant-friendly insurance underwriting. There are many challenging problems to solve in the insurance industry and a massive opportunity to operate it more profitably and effectively.

Kalepa is led by a strong team with experiences from Facebook, APT (acquired by Mastercard for $600M in 2015), the Israel Defense Forces, MIT, Berkeley, and UPenn.

About you:

  • You enjoy understanding customer business needs and translating them into specifications or code
  • You are excited about using a wide set of technologies, ultimately focused on finding the right tool for the job
  • You are energized by automating the collection, parsing, reconciliation, and storage of huge volumes of disparate data from a variety of sources
  • You want to design a flexible analytics, data science, and AI framework to transform the insurance industry
  • You value open, frank, and respectful communication
  • You are a proactive and collaborative problem solver with a “can do” attitude
  • You have in-depth knowledge of Python, SQL and no-SQL databases, and hands-on experience with Python server-side frameworks
  • You have hands-on experience with data analytics and data engineering
  • You have experience with AWS infrastructure

As a plus:

  • You have hands-on experience with machine learning algorithms, NLP, and image recognition
  • You have familiarity with Spark, Hadoop, and OLAP tools
  • You have knowledge of Go and Scala

What you’ll get

  • Work with an ambitious, smart, and fun team to transform a $1T global industry
  • Ground floor opportunity – opportunity to build the foundations for the product, team, and culture alongside the founding team
  • Wide-ranging intellectual challenges spanning full-stack software development, AI / ML, and strong design
  • Competitive compensation package with a significant equity component

title: Senior or Lead Software Engineer
description:
As a Senior Analytics Software Engineer, you will be responsible for advancing software solutions to support BCG Gamma’s analytics platform and clients. Your strong analytical skills and ability to develop innovative problem solving solutions will support mission critical decision analytics for our clients. Additional responsibilities will include developing feature enhancements to our platform, developing industry-leading analytics software solutions and methodologies and provide talks and papers in industry leading conferences on behalf of BCG Gamma. We are looking for talented individuals with a serious commitment to software development, data science, large data analytics and transforming organizations into analytics led innovative companies.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Apply software development practices and standards to develop robust and maintainable software
  • Develop abstract analytic models to solve complex problems for decision analysis
  • Maintain an active role in every part of the software development life cycle
  • Help mentor and guide junior developers
  • Guide non-technical teams and consultants in understanding analytics at scale, infrastructure as code and best practices for robust software development
  • Optimize and enhance computational efficiency of algorithms and software design
  • Design data structures and visualization of results to provide users actionable intelligence and situational awareness of supporting data
  • Interact directly with clients on new features for future product releases
  • Provide thought leadership to software design and solutions

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Masters Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Operations Research, or related field
  • 6 to 12 years of experience in a software development environment
  • Proficiency with analytic software programming
  • Familiarity with data science methods and scaling data science methods
  • Familiarity with the storage, manipulation and management of relational, non-relational and streaming data structures
  • Analytic reasoning and complex problem solving involving mathematical programming and big data problems
  • Understanding of parallel computing

TECHNOLOGIES:

  • Languages programming: Python, GO, C++, Java, Scala, JavaScript, TypeScript
  • DevOps: Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD, Terraform, unix-based command line
  • Full stack development: GraphQL, React
  • Data: SQL, Spark, Hadoop
  • Data Science and machine learning (Pandas, Scikit learn)
  • Deep learning (Tensorflow, Keras etc.)
  • Cloud: AWS/Azure/Google

WORK ENVIRONMENT:

  • Fast-paced, intellectually intense, service-oriented environment
  • Several positions available, they are located in Gamma European hubs (Paris, London, Germany, Nordics etc.)
  • Fluency in local language and English are required
  • Expect time spent traveling

title: Business Informatie Analist
description:
Zin in een nieuwe IT-baan? Kom bij Univé werken als Business Informatie Analist!

Voor het IT businessteam zoeken wij een

Business Informatie Analist Werk jij graag in een omgeving waar ruimte is voor plezier en oog voor elkaar? Aarzel dan niet en solliciteer!

De uitdaging Voorkomen, beperken en verzekeren heeft een centrale plek in de strategie van Univé. Wij helpen onze klanten risico’s te voorkomen en schade te beperken. En wat we niet kunnen voorkomen f beperken, verzekeren we gewoon goed.

Als Business Informatie Analist werk je in op DevOps gebaseerde Agile teams en ben je continue bezig om de beloftes aan onze klanten waar te maken. Je vertaalt de vragen van onze businesspartners naar gewenste (IT) oplossingen. Je hebt een belangrijke brugfunctie tussen klantvraag en technische oplossingen, binnen de kaders van onze architectuur. Je overlegt met verschillende belanghebbenden binnen Univé en stemt mogelijkheden af met onze leveranciers.

Wie ben jij? Jij vind het leuk om de link te zijn tussen IT en de business. Als geen ander weet je hoe je de belangen van de verschillende stakeholders bij elkaar brengt. Hierbij komen jouw communicatieve skills goed tot zijn recht. Daarnaast vind je het belangrijk dat er ruimte is voor jouw ambitie en ontwikkeling.

Verder vinden wij het belangrijk dat je:

  • HBO/WO werk- en denkniveau hebt met een relevante vakgerichte opleiding;
  • Minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring hebt in een vergelijkbare rol, bij voorkeur op het snijvlak van Business en IT;
  • Ervaring hebt met Agile werken;
  • Kennis van de verzekeringsbranche en Microsoft Dynamics 365 is een pré.

Wat bieden wij? We vragen veel van je. Maar we hebben je ook veel te bieden. Het salaris is maximaal € 62.900,00 bruto per jaar op basis van een 38-urige werkweek (inclusief vakantiegeld, een dertiende maand en exclusief variabele beloning). Een uitdagende functie binnen een dynamische organisatie voor 36-40 uur per week.

De belangrijkste arbeidsvoorwaarden op een rijtje:

  • je krijgt een prima salaris, afhankelijk van je kennis, opleiding en ervaring;
  • 13e maand;
  • Variabele Collectieve Prestatie Beloning van maximaal 9% van het jaarsalaris;
  • arbeidsvoorwaardenkeuzesyteem: tijd voor geld of geld voor tijd;
  • 27 vakantiedagen bij een 38-urige werkweek;
  • goede studiekostenregeling;
  • prima pensioenvoorziening;
  • reiskostenvergoeding voor woon-werkverkeer;
  • en natuurlijk: korting op je schade- en zorgverzekeringen bij Univé.

Het businessteam Marketing & Verkoop heeft een fijne werkplek in Zwolle, vlakbij het station en met gratis parkeren. Thuiswerken of werken in één van onze andere vestigingen behoort tot de mogelijkheden.

Wie zijn wij? Werken bij een verzekeraar saai? Niet bij Univé! Wij zijn volop in beweging. Wij groeien, zijn ambitieus en willen het verschil maken voor onze leden. Terug naar de kracht van Univé, noemen wij dat. Om dit waar te maken, willen we voorop lopen in technologische ontwikkelingen en investeren wij continu in innovatieve projecten. We hebben afgelopen jaren al concrete stappen gezet met de introductie van onze nieuwe CRM omgeving. Onze ambitie is de dienstverlening aan onze klanten steeds verder te verbeteren waarbij we onze klant altijd uitstekend helpen welke kanaal men ook gebruikt. En altijd zoals je van Univé gewend bent: persoonlijk en dichtbij!

Overige informatie Enthousiast? Solliciteer dan direct via de onze sollicitatiepagina. Wil je eerst meer informatie over de functie of het proces mail dan naar recruitment@unive.nl. Wij nemen dan contact met je op.

Bijzonderheden Een screening maakt onderdeel uit van de sollicitatieprocedure. Een assessment kan onderdeel uitmaken van de sollicitatieprocedure.

Omdat we zoeken naar mensen die perfect bij ons passen houden we de werving en selectie graag in eigen hand. Wij maken daarom geen gebruik van diensten van uitzendbureaus en/of werving & selectiebureaus.

Meer informatie over onze arbeidsvoorwaarden en over werken bij Univé vind je op: unive.nl/werkenbij

Let op: je krijgt altijd automatisch een ontvangstbevestiging via de mail. Krijg je deze bevestiging niet binnen 24 uur, neem dan even contact met ons op.

title: Chief Technology Officer ( CTO / CIO )
description:
What is Stukent?

Stukent is a digital courseware provider focused on producing first-in-the world simulations and etextbooks to hundreds of thousands of students around the world. Not only does Stukent provide up-to-date textbooks, but hands-on courseware for instructors and students alike. Our mission is to help educators help students help the world. We take pride in our growth (#268 in the Inc. 500), excellent office culture and the development of our employees.

Job Description

We are on a tear to build new technologies that our customer base is begging us to create. Over the next few years we plan to launch dozens of applications and we need someone who can help us scale our engineering team to accomplish that. With strong, natural leadership abilities, the CTO will work to lead and motivate a team of ~15 software developers here at Stukent. We are seeking a professional who is confident in their technical abilities and is enthusiastic about teaching others these vital skills. The CTO is someone who will be self-motivating and prone to taking initiative.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  • Successfully manage both time-sensitive and long-term projects in a calm and keen manner
  • Mentor a team of extremely capable software developers
  • Motivate team members to develop exceptional leadership qualities through an expert level of hands-on experience
  • Be assertive in implementing new ideas and willing to listen to the creative ideas of others
  • Oversee all production by the software developers and hold frequent meetings to continually improve your team

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required

  • Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent; Master’s Degree preferred
  • 10+ years experience in building and leading engineering teams
  • Broad technological expertise that will inspire and encourage creative and unified problem solving
  • Experience in coaching and mentoring as you work through difficult problems to achieve high levels of trust with each employee
  • Broad knowledge of software engineering languages, frameworks, techniques, etc.
  • Strong department leadership skills, including, strategic planning, process development and goal setting
  • Good judgement in high stress situations
  • Strong knowledge in cloud-based architectures and experience with AWS, GCP, or Azure.
  • Experience in building monolithic and web-service based applications at scale.
  • Experience with cloud-based messaging architectures which include pub/sub and event-based, and RPC systems.
how_to_apply: Please email your resume and cover letter to: katharine.juchau@stukent.com

title: Software Engineer
description:
As a Software Engineer at KickUp, you will build the systems that empower teacher growth through data.You will work with a diverse group of engineers, designers, and client success managers, finding new ways to track, plan, and reflect on professional learning. You will own feature development through the whole software lifecycle -- from spec to development to QA to release. You will sharpen your skills as a full-stack developer, getting to work in every part of our stack, from dev-ops through our design system. You will work with the rest of the engineering team to evolve our best practices and bring new technologies and knowledge into our stack

Skills & Experience:

2-5 years of professional building web apps and supporting them in production

1-2 years of professional experience with React, Angular, or Vue

1-2 years of professional experience with a server-side web framework (such as Django, Ruby on Rails, NodeJS, Laravel, etc.)

Ability to communicate complex technical ideas in clear and simple language

Ability to write code that is robust, reusable, and testable

Experience with Docker, Celery, Amazon ECS, or Redux is a plus

Bring Your Whole Self: We believe diversity breeds innovation. We're building a product that improves the way all teachers and all students are supported, and to do that well, we need a workforce that’s representative of the users we serve. We are actively looking to add members to our team who will bring diverse backgrounds, new perspectives, and a willingness to challenge us to improve the work we do every day.

Why you should join KickUp: Our mission is to meaningfully engage educators in professional growth. Education is in our team’s DNA, and study after study demonstrates that educators have the single greatest impact on student learning. KickUp exists to help districts grow their teachers through high-quality professional learning and well-coordinated improvement efforts, and your work at KickUp will lead to system-level change in education.

Our team is humble and sharp, with a unique blend of both mission driven and business smart qualities. Because we offer our clients both software and services, we’re able to build deep relationships and garner deep insight into the needs of our users in order to be a highly user-focused team. We work closely together to share learnings, solve cross-team problems, and maintain a cohesive, small-team feel and community spirit as we grow our organization.

Our product is a dynamic platform that helps school districts design, coordinate and assess their professional learning activities, giving educational leaders a coherent and actionable picture of their program's effectiveness. Working at KickUp will give you the chance to create new experiences with a modern stack built on a React-based JavaScript front-end, an API tier written in Django, and deployed via Docker containers.

Benefits: At KickUp, one of our core values is Balanced Hustle. We believe in flexibility and the importance of recharging—and as a result, offer an unlimited PTO policy. Most of our employees average between 15-18 PTO days per year in addition to 10 paid company holidays.

We offer flexibility to accommodate daily work preferences by providing options for remote work or varied work hours.

We offer competitive salaries, stock options in our growing company, and a variety of medical, dental and vision insurance options.

We provide opportunities for professional growth and offer individual stipends for professional learning opportunities

Our offices are conveniently located in Old City, Philadelphia with easy accessibility to public transportation, restaurants, and green space.

title: Senior JavaScript-Developer - Angular/React (m/f/d)
description:
We combine our passion for innovative technology with decades of experience in B2B business. METRO MARKETS will develop and launch the online B2B marketplace that will change how businesses make purchases online.

Online marketplaces have never been this awesome.

To you, coding is not just coding but an opportunity to create awesomeness. You will develop our complex online marketplace from scratch, focusing on the platform’s front-end. You will take charge of the concept build and continuous implementation of new features for our marketplace, ensuring performance optimization by collaborating with amazing colleagues in cross-functional teams.

Join our team of passionate technology enthusiasts and e-commerce specialists in our brand-new tech company in Düsseldorf!

You've got

  • Plenty of practical experience in front-end development (JavaScript, HTML, CSS)
  • Solid knowledge of modern front-end technologies (Angular, React, Vue)
  • Experience in collaborating with product owners and strong customer orientation
  • Great analytical skills in process optimization and a customer-centered mindset

We've got

  • An innovative product with an incredibly exciting tech stack
  • A “greenfield” project – an agile environment with a start-up mentality, no bureaucracy, flat hierarchies and the courage to evaluate new approaches
  • An international team in a modern office close to the Rhine river
  • If you’re not from Germany – we will help you with your visa and support you with your relocation process

title: Développeur C++ / Software Engineer / Proxy Product Owner
description:
Description de l'entreprise

Créée en 2007 à Montréal, Dental Wings est une société internationale intégrée au Groupe Straumann et se spécialise dans le domaine des solutions numériques dentaires. Dental Wings emploie plus de 180 personnes à travers le monde. En plus de notre siège social de Montréal, nous avons des bureaux en Allemagne, en France et en Chine.

Nous offrons un environnement dynamique et agile propice à l’esprit entrepreneurial et au travail d’équipe, des projets stimulants dans une industrie de pointe et la possibilité d’avancement professionnel.

Nos activités chez Dental Wings incluent la conception, le développement et la fabrication de produits logiciels et matériels destinés aux dentistes et aux laboratoires dentaires.

Au sein du département R&D hardware, le développeur C++/ Proxy Product Owner participera au développement et à la mise au point des nouveaux modèles de scanners 3D dentaires. Vous aurez l’opportunité de travailler dans une équipe multidisciplinairecomposée de développeurs logiciel, d'électroniciens, d'ingénieurs optiques et mécaniques sur du matériel utilisant les dernières technologies en matière de numérisation 3D de précision (projecteurs et caméras couplés à des algorithmes de reconstruction 3D).

Sous la supervision du chef d’équipe et en collaboration avec le Product Owner, vous participerez dans un environnement agile à la conception et à l’implémentation de différentes composantes logicielles nécessaires pour piloter les scanners ainsi qu’à l’animation des évènements Scrum auprès de l’équipe de développement.

Description du poste

En tant que développeur C++/Proxy Product Owner, vous aurez l'occasion de:__

  • Participer au développement logiciel en C++ (80% du temps);
  • Participer à l’analyse et à la planification des nouvelles fonctionnalités à implémenter;
  • Participer à l’amélioration continue du code;
  • Interfacer et supporter le Product Owner auprès de l’équipe de développement en agissant en tant que proxy Product Owner (20% du temps);
  • Animer les daily scrums avec le Scrum Master;
  • S’assurer du bon déroulement des sprints de développement.

Qualifications

  • Baccalauréat en informatique ou baccalauréat en génie informatique ou équivalent;
  • Solide expérience en développement C++;
  • Expérience pertinente de développement en utilisant la méthode Agile Scrum;
  • Maîtrise de la programmation orientée objet, parallèle et concurrente;
  • Aptitude à analyser des systèmes complexes et à penser à des solutions innovantes;
  • Habilité à travailler en équipe et à communiquer clairement avec les différents intervenants;
  • Sens des responsabilités et capacité à comprendre et atteindre les objectifs;
  • Maîtriser du français, à l’oral et l’écrit;
  • Maîtriser de l’anglais, à l’écrit;
  • Atout : notions de vision par ordinateur;
  • Atout : connaissance de Visual Studio, Git et Redmine.

Renseignements complémentaires

  • Horaire flexible;
  • Dîners-conférences;
  • Assurances collectives;
  • Accessible en transports en commun et près de la station de métro Pie-IX;
  • REER avec contribution de l'employeur;
  • Journées flottantes;
  • Fruits, bagels, cafés et thés gratuits;
  • Activités sociales et sportives (soirées de jeux de société, jeux vidéos, hockey, soccer, basket-ball, 5@7, etc..).

title: (Senior) Java Softwareentwickler (m/w/d) für Cloud
description:
Fuhrparks in über 40 Ländern verlassen sich auf unsere smarten und zukunftsweisenden Mobilitätslösungen. Werden Sie Teil eines engagierten und begeisterten Teams, das die gewerbliche Mobilität von morgen europaweit mitgestaltet.

Nehmen Sie Einfluss

  • Entwicklung und Betrieb neuer zukunftsweisender Internetanwendungen auf Applikati-onsservern sowie CloudUmgebungen
  • Realisierung weiterer Softwarekomponenten an bestehenden JavaSysteme unter An-wendung agiler Arbeitsweisen
  • Entwicklung von anspruchsvollen technischen Konzepten und Architekturen auf der Ba-sis aktueller Java- und CloudTechnologien
  • Mitarbeit bei der Erstellung funktionaler und technischer Anforderungsbeschreibungen
  • Evaluierung neuer Technologien im Umfeld der bestehenden Lösungen
  • Mitarbeit bei der Pflege bestehender Applikationen

Das macht Sie aus

  • Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen oder vergleichbare technische Ausbildung mit Berufserfahrung
  • Fundierte Kenntnisse in objektorientierter Analyse und Design von Java Anwendungen
  • Kenntnisse im Cloud Umfeld und erste Erfahrungen mit Kubernetes, Openshift, Keyclo-ak oder Kafka von Vorteil
  • Gute Kenntnisse gängiger Java – Frameworks (Spring, JSF / PrimeFaces, GWT, Hiber-nate, Maven)
  • Kenntnisse verschiedener Application Server und Servlet Container (Wildfly, Tomcat) sowie Microservices sowie Test Strategien und – Frameworks (JUnit, Selenium, jmeter)
  • Sicherer Umgang mit CI/CD Pipelines, GIT, Jenkins, Artifactory und Sonarqube
  • Gute Kenntnisse bei der Verwendung von SchnittstellenTechnologien (REST, SOAP)

Davon werden Sie profitieren

Bei uns finden Sie beste Voraussetzungen, um Zukunft zu gestalten. Unser internationales Team widmet sich mit Drive neuen Herausforderungen. Sie finden bei uns

  • Freiraum für eigene Ideen,
  • flexible Arbeitszeiten mit Home-Office und Gleitzeit,
  • eine attraktive Vergütung mit leistungsgerechten Boni,
  • Möglichkeiten zur Weiterentwicklung
  • und viele weitere Extras.

Interessiert?

Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung über den bewerbungsformular.

Klicken Sie hier um zum Bewerbungsformular zu gelangen!

Für Ihre Rückfragen steht Ihnen Lisa Pieper unter +49 2102 5517-204 zur Verfügung.

DKV Euro Service – DKV MOBILITY SERVICES Group

Als führender europäischer Mobilitätsdienstleister widmen wir uns effizienten Mobilitätslösungen zur Steuerung gewerblicher Fuhrparks und bringen Digitalisierung auf die Straße. Zu unserem Portfolio gehören smarte Produkte und Dienstleistungen rund ums Tanken, alternative Antriebsarten, Mautabwicklung, Liquiditätsvorteile und innovative vernetzte Services.

In unserem Know-how steckt die Kompetenz von mehr als 1.000 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeitern in 13 Ländern. Der DKV Euro Service ist Teil der DKV MOBILITY SERVICES Group, die 2018 einen Umsatz von 8,6 Milliarden Euro erwirtschaftete. Mit vier Gruppenunternehmen gestalten wir erfolgreich Mobilität: DKV Euro Service, REMOBIS Refund Service, LUNADIS und DKV MOBILITY SERVICES Business Center.
